meanings.definition: A form of government where all individuals have equal political power.
meanings.sent1: In an isocracy, every person has the same amount of say in decision-making.
meanings.sent2: Isocracy ensures that no one person or group dominates the political landscape.
meanings.sent3: The isocracy in this fictional land led to some hilarious voting tiebreakers.
meanings.sent4: The idea of isocracy is like a symphony where every instrument plays a crucial role.
meanings.sent5: Imagine an isocracy as a perfectly balanced seesaw of power among citizens.

meanings.definition: The principle or practice of equal political power among all individuals.
meanings.sent1: The isocracy of this system promotes fairness and equality for all.
meanings.sent2: Isocracy aims to prevent any form of political hierarchy from forming.
meanings.sent3: The isocracy of the school council elections made for an interesting outcome.
meanings.sent4: In a world of isocracy, every voice is like a bright star shining equally.
meanings.sent5: The concept of isocracy is a powerful beacon of democracy and unity.
